inn1.comm: caught at second slip! Wow wow wow! What a catch there by the NZ skipper! Two handed, flying to his left, over his head! It was a back of length delivery that cut away from the left-hander, who got a thick outside edge that flew towards the slip cordon. McCullum flew to his left to pull off a stunner.
similar delivery, but Sanga goes right behind it and defends it towards off
not much bounce this time! It was a length ball angled across the batsman. Sanga left it alone
fuller delivery outside off, this one is taken waist high by the keeper after Sanga left it alone
back of length delivery on the stumps, Sanga goes back and dabs it towards the leg side for a quick single
another quick single this time. Dilshan pushes a length delivery towards mid-on, where Vettori is a touch slow to start
starts off with a length delivery on off stump, Dilshan comes forward and defends
there is some movement into the right hander this time from short of a length. Dilshan defends it awkwardly back to the bowler as he gets hit high on the bat
on the middle stump line, the batsman whips it past square leg for a couple of runs
on the pads this time and Dilshan flicks it fine on the leg side and picks up another couple
he tries to go full this time and there is indeed come swing available, but it is down the leg side
length delivery bowled with a loud grunt, goes across the right hander. Dilshan leaves it alone
length delivery on off, touch fuller and Dilshan punches it on the up past the non-striker for the first boundary of the day. No chance for any fielder, even though he hadn't timed it well
shortish delivery down the leg side, but the bowler gets away with it. Not a wide says umpire, the batsman had walked across to the off side a bit
length delivery outside off, left alone by Sanga and it doesn't bounce much
another short delivery and it doesn't bounce very high again, but it's down the leg side and again, not called a wide
length delivery on the pads, Sanga flicks it to fine leg for a single
back of length delivery on off, Dilshan gets up on his toes and punches it towards mid-off. He calls for a quick single and makes it easily
he stays on the back foot and pushes the length delivery outside off to the man at cover
length delivery on off, Dilshan again pushes it past the non-striker with soft hands and thinks about a single, but decides against it immediately
short delivery, Dilshan was quick to rock back and swivel to pull it past square leg for a boundary
another short ball, more effort this time by the bowler and there was a loud grunt too.. Dilshan goes for a pull, but bottom edges it on to his body

length delivery outside off, Dilshan tries to leave it belatedly, but the ball hits the face of the bat and just drops short of the fielder at second slip. The fielder doesn't take it cleanly allowing a run
length ball outside off, moves away a touch, Sanga lets it go through
back of length delivery on off stumps, Sanga goes back and defends it towards midwicket
back of length delivery, punched to cover off the back foot
length delivery on the stumps, angling in, the batsman pushes it to midwicket off the front foot

beautiful delivery! caught Dilshan off guard completely.. It was angled in and it straightened just a touch  to beat the batsman as he tries to push it towards the leg side.. It bounced over the off stump
this one comes in  from the same angle and Dilshan nudged it towards square leg off the back foot
he stays on the back foot and opens the face of the bat to push the length delivery to point
here comes a Sanga special! Mills pushes it further up and the batsman goes down on his knee and creams it through cover.. Pretty sight this one
and now Dilshan joins in the fun! He gets a full delivery and he drives it on the up through cover, slightly in the air, but in the gap and it makes it to the boundary

ordinary shot by Dilshan as he misses a fuller length delivery and has his stumps rattled! Maybe it came in a touch, but Dilshan went forward for a lazy push towards the leg side,leaving a big gap between the bat and the pad and the ball hit the top of middle.
he gets a full delivery on the middle and leg line first up, Mahela stays in the crease and defends it towards the leg side
length delivery on off stump, the batsman stays in the crease and defends it to the off side
length delivery outside off and Mahela gets off the mark with a steer to third man
loud shout for leg before as the batsman gets hit around the knee roll trying to whip the length delivery to the leg side, but that was probably heading down
he bowls a length delivery outside off, the batsman lets it go through
another length delivery angled across the left-hander, who lets it go through easily
another length delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward, then lets it go
length delivery on the stumps, Sanga stays on the back foot and whips it to midwicket, where the fielder is not able to stop it cleanly, allowing a run
length delivery on the stumps again, this time Mahela goes on the back foot and turns it towards square leg for a single
length delivery on off stump, the batsman defends it off the back foot
pushed through outside off, Mahela comes forward to defend but gets an inside edge towards fine leg
flatter and quicker on the stumps, the batsman defends it to the leg side off the back foot
some spin and bounce this time! it was flatter and shorter, it zips past the outside edge as Mahela came forward

tossed up and slower, the batsman comes forward to defend, but this one doesn't turn at all, it misses the inside edge and thuds on to the pads.. Vettori appeals, the umpire concurs..Mahela thinks about reviewing it for a second, but then walks away.. It would have been a waste to review it as that was a very good shout
he bowls a quicker one, the batsman defends it towards off
tossed up full, drifts in a touch, the batsman comes forward and defends it back to the bowler
fuller delivery just outside off, Sanga takes a tiny step forward and punches it to mid-on
back of length outside off, Sanga goes on the back foot and punches it nicely to the off side, but straight to the man at cover
length delivery, on the fuller side, but Sanga stays in the crease and opens the face to run it down to third man for a single
he pitches it short and aims it at the body, Chandimal jumps and arches back to get out of the line, as if it was bowled at 150 kph..
a length delivery follows the shorter snorter! Chandimal was slow to come forward and gets a loud outside edge through to the keeper. Loose shot in the end and one more is back in the hut.
length delivery outside off, the batsman hops on his toes and defends it to the leg side
he bowls it on a length around off stump, Sanga goes on the back foot and defends it solidly back to the bowler
he goes fuller this time, angled across the left hander, the batsman lets it go through
another fuller delivery wide outside off this time, the batsman leaves it alone
tries to bring it closer to the batsman, but bowls it down the leg side
good delivery on a length outside off, but Sanga has a better answer as he punches it through extra cover off the back foot
short of length delivery outside off, the batsman drops his wrists and sways out of line
length delivery on off stump, Angelo defends it towards mid-on
length ball on off, Sanga pushes it to mid-off and takes off.. But Angelo was looking towards the fielder.. Sanga got halfway and then ran back
length delivery just outside off, defended from the crease towards the off side
this time it's on the pads and Sanga nips it fine leg with a wristy flick
short delivery, but towards the leg stump line. Angelo hops and tucks it to the left of the wicketkeeper
length delivery on off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends it back to the bowler
another length delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends it solidly to cover
he bowls it very full on off stump, the batsman tries to whip it to the leg side, but finds the man at midwicket
back of length this time, the batsman defends it off the back foot

length delivery outside off, the batsman chooses to play it off the back foot, but the ball comes in after pitching, catches the inside edge, hits the thigh pad, then luckily falls short of the cordon
another length delivery on the stumps, he defends it to midwicket off the back foot
fuller length delivery on off stump, the batsman defends it from the crease
this time he comes forward and defends the fuller length delivery to mid-on
tossed up delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to cover point and takes off for a quick single
tossed up delivery on off, the batsman defends it towards midwicekt
he comes forward and solidly defends the full and flighted delivery to the off side
pushed through on off, the batsman defends off the back foot
another flatter delivery on off, the batsman defends it off the front foot
flatter, quicker and on the middle stump line, the batsman defends it to the leg side
length delivery on off stump, and as easily as only Sanga can do, he pushes it back towards the non-striker, but once the ball passes Chandimal, it picks up pace and beats the man at mid-off
length delivery on the middle stump line, the batsman defends it to midwicket
fuller delivery outside off, beautifully driven, but straight to the man at mid-off
length delivery angled across the batsman, Sanga covers the line of the stumps and lets it go through
a half-volley outside off and Sanga obliges by driving it nicely, but the field is packed on the off side and he hits it straight to short cover
length delivery on off and middle stump, the batsman defends it down the pitch
short of a length, outside off, pushed past cover for one
shortish again, punched to deep point easily
and he is short again, and has been worked away for an easy single
flighted this time, on off, pushed back to him
another forward-defensive as he tosses this up on off
quicker to finish the over off, punched to long-off for one
wide length ball, driven on the up, past cover, all along the ground
driven on the up again, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, on the pads, tucked away for one
short of a length, on off, defended to leg
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot again
another defensive push, this is straight of mid-on, and they get a single
flighted outside off, defended with the turn, to short midwicket
driven to long-on for one
flighted on off, defended back to him
slower through the air, blocked off the front foot
short of a length, back-cuts this to right of deep point for two
clipped away off the toe, to the right of deep midwicket, gets another couple
tossed up on the middle stump line, tucked to short fine leg
tossed up on the stumps, drifts in a touch, the batsman defends it back to the bowler
full and flighted on the leg stump, the batsman tries to push it to the on side, but gets a leading edge to off
fuller on off, pushes towards mid-off
quicker delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and defends
pushed through outside off, this time the batsman lets it go through
he bowls a fuller length delivery outside off, the batsman lets it go through
back of length outside off, the batsman defends it towards cover off the back foot
length delivery outside off, the batsman stylishly punches it to the fielder at cover point off the front foot
he bowls a length delivery on the stumps, the batsman pushes it to mid-on
short delivery this time, but this is outside off and the batsman easily sways out of line
another short delivery, this time the batsman arches back and pulls it along the ground to fine leg for a single
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to the left of midwicket fielder and calls for a quick single
he comes down the pitch and takes the flighted delivery on the full, then smacks it over midwicket for a powerfully hit shot. That drifted in to the batsman, and he adjusted his shot well
flatter delivery this time, the batsman defends it to cover off the back foot
slower and flighted on off, the batsman comes forward and defends
pushed through on the stumps, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
shorter this time and quicker too, the batsman waits and defends it back to the bowler
short of length delivery outside off, the batsman gets up on his toes and punches it to deep extra cover

he has taken the leg stump down! What a blow! Angelo was looking good and was holding up the end but this time, he tries to go back and across the tickle the length delivery to the leg side, but misses it. He has walked too far across unfortunately.. A repeat of the Suresh Raina dismissal from the warm-up match between India and Australia
he keeps bowling with that grunt of his, this time outside off. The batsman lets it go through
back of length delivery outside off, the batsman defends it towards point off the back foot
another short of length delivery, this time on the stumps, Thirimanne dabs it to midwicket for a single

that was close! the batsmen took a couple after Sanga punched a length delivery to deep extra cover, but the throw from the deep was flat and quick and Thirimanne had to dive in to make it back in time
tossed up and full outside off, the batsman defends it off the front foot
pushed through on the pads, the batsman goes back and tickles it towards backward square leg for a single
another one pushed through, this time on off stump, the batsman defends it to the off side
flatter and shorter on the stumps, the batsman dabs it towards square leg for a single
tossed up outside off, the batsman comes forward to defend, but gets an inside edge towards square leg
quicker delivery on the pads, the batsman goes back and defends it towards square leg
back of length outside off, Sanga punches it forcefully to deep cover for a single
short delivery this time, dug in halfway, the batsman ducks under it easily
length delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends to off
back of length delivery outside off, the batsman lets it go through, but the bowler comes tumbling down on to the pitch
he draws the edge this time, but it doesn't carry to the slip fielder. Way short of the fielder.
another short of length delivery outside off, the batsman gets out of the way
shorter and quicker outside off, the batsman goes back and punches it down to long on for a single
slower and tossed up outside off, the batsman goes back and defends it towards point
flatter this time and on the middle stump line, the batsman defends it towards midwicket
tossed up on off, the batsman defends it off the front foot
keeps it tight around off and middle, pushed back to the bowler
flatter delivery on the stumps, the batsman tucks it to the leg side, but straight to the man at square leg
slow tossed up delivery on off, the batsman goes back and pushes it towards mid-on for a single
tossed up full and on the middle stump, driven to long off
flatter delivery on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to leg side and takes off for a single. KW gets there too and fires a throw at non-striker's end..But the batsmen dived in to make his ground
tossed up and slow on off, defended to cover
flatter delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to mid-off
slower, tossed up, wide of off, draws the batsman into a loose shot, the ball grips the surface and turns past the outside edge
slower and on off stump, the batsman dabs it towards point and calls for a quick single
quicker delivery outside off, the batsman defends it to point off the back foot
he comes down the pitch and drives the flighted delivery to midwicket
tossed up delivery and a bit wide of off, the batsman goes down on his knee and goes with a slog-sweep, over midwicket and to the boundary
pushed through on off, the batsman defends it to cover
comes down the pitch and pushes it to mid-off, calls for a quick single as the fielder is a touch slow
is that a catch gone down? Looked like it. There was a loud noise as the batsman went for cut, but the keeper was not able to hold on to it. Thick edge actually, harsh to call it a drop

both men are at the same end! Horrible horrible mix up! Sanga pushed it towards the right of cover fielder and took a couple of steps down. Thirimanne took it as a cue for a run and ran all the way down...But Guptill dived and stopped the ball, Sanga stopped as a result, but Thiri ran all the way down. Gutpill didn't even stop the ball cleanly, but since the two batters were at the same end, he had ample time to throw it to the non-striker's end
oh no! Sanga almost gave it away!He charged down the pitch to drive it over the infield, but didn't get hold of it, it just cleared the fielder at mid-on
it's on the pads this time, now Sanga sweeps it fine past the short fine leg fielder
charges down, this one is a clean shot! He didn't go hard on it, just chipped it easily over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four..
length delivery on the middle, Thisara punches it softly with his heavy bat, but the fielder at mid-on has to dive to stop that.. such is the power of this man
short delivery, pitched halfway, the batsman ducks under it easily
more good work by Guptill, this time at midwicket. The batsman drove it towards the left of him with the inside half of the bat

dropped by the bowler! An easy catch by any standards. The batsman punched it right back, not at great speed, and it was at a comfortable height to the left of the bowler, but he just couldnt hold on to it
fuller length delivery on off, Perera punches it hard to mid-off, but Franklin allows the ball to slip under his hands and gives away four runs
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and defends
Sanga gets to his fifty with a push to long off, more than half of Sri Lanka's runs have been scored by him
quicker and shorter outside off, the batsman goes back and cuts it, but straight to the man at backward point
tossed up full and slow, the batsman defends it to cover

pushed through a bit quicker this time and straightaway they go up for an appeal as Thisara gets hit on the pads while he is on the back foot..Looked good to the naked eye, except that there was a loud woody noise. Thisara calls for a review and wins it easily. Big inside edge
tossed up delivery on middle and leg line, the batsman comes forward and defends
fuller and quicker, the batsman punches it straight to mid-on
length delivery outside off, Sanga defends it to the off side
another length ball round about off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
full and on to the pads, Sanga easily clips it to the fine-leg boundary
fuller delivery wide outside off, Sanga goes for that down-on-his-knee cover drive, but gets an inside edge past the stumps towards backward square leg
he goes after it like he always does, but gets a thick outside edge that balloons over backward point and a few meters short of the third man fielder
length delivery on the stumps, he pushes it to long on for a single
tossed up and really really slow, the batsman comes forward and defends it to off
flighted delivery, but it's too full, the batsman just easily punches after taking it on the full and drives it through wide mid-on
flighted delivery on off, defended to cover
this time, he pushes it towards midwicket off the front foot
fuller delivery on off stump, driven back to the bowler
tossed up full on off stump, the batsman drives it to wide long-on, past a diving Martin Guptill at extra cover
back of length on off, defended to the off side
length delivery outside off, punched hard to the off side, but straight to extra cover
short delivery this time, the batsman arches back to ramp it over the keeper's head, but makes no connection
bowls a yorker wide outside off, the batsman digs it out towards cover
back of length delivery outside off, Thisara thumps it hard down the ground, but straight to the man at mid-off
fuller length delivery outside off, the batsman swings hard at it and hits it down the ground, Vettori at mid-on does well to cut it off though
pushed through on the middle stump line, the batsman gets an inside edge to the leg side as he comes forward to defend
tossed up delivery on off stump, the batsman defends it solidly off the front foot

drifting on to the leg side, the batsman gets hit on the pads and the ball drops to the off side. The batsmen exchange ends with a quick run, but Ronchi gets to the ball and returns the ball quickly to the bowler. They check for a run out, but Sanga was safe
full delivery, chipped over the bowler's head for a single
another full delivery, Sanga drives it to wide long on all along the ground
flatter delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and defends it to the off side
oh that was wild shot! Sanga wanted to smack the length delivery over the bowler's head and played inside the line, and was beaten
walks across to the off side and tries to drive the fuller length delivery to long-on, but gets an inside edge on to his pads. They take a quick single

caught by mid-on! Wicket goes down just at the right time for New Zealand. It was a length ball outside off, the kind Perera loves to hit out of the ground, but this time he doesn't get hold of it. It goes high and Vettori at mid-on back pedals a few paces to take a well-judged catch

this one hits the pads as it cuts back into Sangakkara from a length, but was comfortably going over the stumps.. A half-hearted appeal by the bowler, but he quickly realises there is no value in that
length delivery on off stump, the batsman defends it back to the bowler

fiercely hit back towards the bowler, who was falling away from it with this follow through, so no chance for him. It was full and wide, Sanga, instead of going towards cover, hit it straight back and gets four for it
pushed through outside off, Herath pushes it towards cover and takes off for a quick single
he moves outside leg stump and drives the flatter delivery to deep cover easily for a single
quicker delivery on off stump, Herath defends it towards the off side
another flatter, quicker delivery, the batsman defends it off the front foot
this one kept a tad low, as the batsman pushed it back to the bowler
another quick delivery, the batsman has no choice but to defend
short of length delivery outside off, the batsman half-ducks half-sways out of the line
attempts a yorker, but the direct is completely wrong, it's down the leg side and Sanga easily helps it on its way to the boundary
length delivery outside off, Sanga pushes it to the right of the cover fielder for a single
a touch of reverse swing there by the bowler as he bowled this one full, Herath pushes it to mid on
beautifully driven through extra cover! Sanga-esque! It was a full delivery with some room, but Herath creams it through to the boundary
back of length delivery on off, the batsman tucks it towards midwicket for a single
tossed up around off stump, the batsman comes forward and dabs it towards square leg for a single

caught at short third man! this could be the difference between 180 and 150! Sanga tries to drive this one over extra cover, but it wasn't full enough and he gets a thick outside edge towards backward point. Kane W moves to his left and completes and easy catch. Huge huge blow this one..
tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends
flatter delivery on off stump line, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
he comes forward and slices the quicker delivery to backward point

tossed up outside, the batsman thinks it's time to hit it to the shorter straight boundary, but he is no Perera, hits it only as far as long-on for a simple catch. Sri Lankan innings is in shambles here.
short of length delivery, the batsman tucks it to short fine leg off his hips
back of length delivery, the batsman drops it towards midwicket for a quick single
he bowls full and outside off, beats the bat as Malinga plays inside the line
full delivery on the stumps, Malinga stays on the back foot and whips it towards deep midwicket for a couple

caught at slip! McC gets no. four! It was a length delivery that the batsman tries to whip it to the leg side, but he gets an outside edge that flies high towards first slip where Taylor takes a sharp catch

inn2.comm: short of length delivery around off stump, the batsman gets right behind it and defends it to the off side
length delivery outside off, Guptill defends it towards point off the back foot
back of length delivery outside off, the batsman goes back and defends it to off
length delivery on off, Guptill prods forward and defends it to cover
length delivery on middle and off line, the batsman stays solid behind it and punches it to mid-on
length delivery outside off, the batsman pushes it towards point where Dilshan makes a good diving stop
beautiful delivery, it beats the bat outside off. He bowled it from wide of the crease, it was angled in, and straightened late past the outside edge
length ball outside off, the batsman pushes it to the right of point for first runs
length delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and lets it go through
back of length delivery, but it's on the middle and leg line, Guptill clips it fine on the leg side and Malinga at fine leg does well to prevent the boundary by diving across
length delivery wide outside off, it swings further away, the batsman leaves it alone
fuller length delivery just outside off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it in the gap at cover, but he has timed that very well as it beats the fielder to the boundary
short of length delivery outside off, Ronchi watches it closely and lets it go through
attempts the slower yorker, but luckily for the batsman, it's a full toss on the pads. Ronchi didn't read it very well and played it belatedly towards midwicket, off the toe-end of his bat
he follows it up with a sharp bouncer and the batsman does well to sway out of the way
another slower ball this time and it's a full toss, on the middle stump line, the batsman chips it over the bowler's head for an easy boundary
another short delivery this time, the batsman ducks under it
length delivery wide outside off, the batsman tries to cut it hard but is beaten by the pace on that
length delivery, but straying on to the pads, the batsman whips it down to fine leg for a single
fuller length this time, but again on to the pads, the batsman flicks it to deep backward square leg for more runs
very short delivery this time round but Ronchi gets out of the way easily

here comes the first wicket! It was a length delivery outside off, very quick as well, and Ronchi wanted to push it to the off side without moving his feet, but the bowler gets some extra bounce off the pitch and the ball flicks the outside edge on its way to the keeper's gloves
length delivery on off stump, the batsman tries to punch it to off, but gets an inside edge towards square leg to get off the mark
he goes for a yorker from wide of the crease, the batsman digs it out towards midwicket
another outside edge, but the batsman played this one with soft hands and it dropped way short of the fielder at first slip
and they go up for an appeal for caught behind now, but the bowler doesn't show much interest. There was nothing in it as it went past the outside edge
short delivery this time, the batsman ducks under it easily
fuller length delivery outside off, the batsman gets a thick outside edge towards third man and he is quick to get back for a second run
another one goes past the outside edge as Kane W plays inside the line
back of length delivery outside off, defended off the back foot towards off
he bowls it from wide of the crease and wide down the leg side. Sanga does well to dive across and keep it to one extra run
back of length delivery wide outside off, the batsman rocks back and wristily punches it through cover point. The ball teases three fielders all the way through to the boundary
shortish delivery, the batsman pulls it to fine leg for a single
short of length delivery outside off, the batsman stands tall and punches it through extra cover for what looked like a couple, but sloppy work by the fielder (Chandimal) allows extra runs

he bowls a low full toss in his attempt to bowl a yorker, the batsman digs it out to his boot and the ball then lobs up in front. There are shouts of 'catch it' but the bowler doesn't really make any attempt.. Could have been a wicket
he defends the short of length delivery off the back foot solidly
length delivery outside off, the batsman lets it go through to the keeper
length ball wide outside off, the batsman goes back and chops it straight to point
fuller length delivery just outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends it solidly to the off side
pushes it fuller and wider outside off, the batsman comes forward and lets it go through to the keeper
it pitches on a length wide outside off and goes further away, the batsman leaves it alone
beautiful delivery! This one is closer to the off stump line and the batsman has to play at it, but it leaves him at the last moment

this one is even better! It pitches short of good length around off stump and the batsman has to play at it again. Kane W tries to defend it off the back foot, but the ball just leaves him at the last moment. The slip cordon goes up immediately, the umpire says no to the appeal, but Angelo asks for a review. Oh that one has gone to waste as that one just went past the outside edge and flicked the trousers on the way to the keeper
pushed through, that was the arm ball and the batsman uses the depth of the crease to go back and punch it to deep midwicket
oye! Super delivery, it was tossed up, pitches on off stump and then spins sharply past the outside edge
tossed up and full on the middle stump line, the batsman sweeps it fine on the leg side and Malinga from deep backward square leg has to run all the way to get that
tossed up again and the batsman tries to paddle it fine, but is not able to beat the fielder at short fine leg
bad delivery, it was short and way down the leg side, the batsman goes for a pull and gets a top edge over the short fine leg fielder
fuller on off, the batsman comes forward and defends it solidly
fuller length delivery outside off, the batsman drills it down the ground with a powerful drive
short delivery this time, Guptill rocks back and comfortably pulls it behind square for another boundary
back of length delivery outside off, he punches it hard straight to cover where Kusal Perera misfields and allows an extra run
length delivery wide outside off, the batsman goes back and punches it to mid-off
he waits on the back foot and punches the length delivery through extra cover, they take four of it. Good running

he is gone this time! It was a slower delivery and it was a high full-toss. Kane Williamson totally lost it in the flight. He tried to nudge it towards the leg side, but was hit on the thigh pad while he was ducking, right in front of the middle stump. Did he get a bat on that? I don't think so. It was hitting the top of the middle. Kane Williamson asks for a review, maybe in the hope that it would have gone over the top, but that was dipping sharply. Malinga strikes and New Zealand lose a review
flighted delivery on off stump, the batsman defends it off the front foot
goes back to a slider on the middle stump, brings his bat down in time to work it away towards deep square leg
pushed through on off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends
tossed up and full outside off, the batsman drives it in the air, but it falls just short of the fielder at short extra cover
full and flighted, the batsman pushes it towards mid-on and thinks about a single, but decides against it

the finger has gone up! No review this time! Herath has done what Dan Vettori did to Mahela. After flighting a couple of deliveries, he bowls the arm ball and Ross Taylor gets hit in front as he plays down the wrong line, the ball thudding onto his front pad in front of the middle stump. It would have gone on to hit middle and leg. Can Sri Lanka set in some panic in the New Zealand camp?

gone! caught at slip! Someone asked for the wobble? Eranga bowls that sharp shortish delivery outside off and the batsman tries to defend it off the back foot, but it took off and the bounce surprised Guptill who ended up fending it towards slip. It flew high and it flew fast and Mahela took a sharp overhead catch.
attempts a yorker first ball, but it's down the leg side. McCullum flicks it to fine leg to get off the mark and bring up New Zealand's fifty
length delivery angling across the left-hander, the batsman defends it towards point
back of length delivery outside off, defended to the off side..
fuller length, it goes away from the left-hander with the angle, Franklin leaves it alone
another yorker attempted, but this one is outside the left-hander's leg stump, the batsman tries to whip it, but it hits his boot and flies past the keeper for a boundary
full and flighted and what does Baz do? He goes for a reverse sweep! He misses it, but luckily for him he gets hit on the boot outside the line of off
he goes back to cut this one, but it stayed a touch low.. Again very lucky. He steals a single to cover though
full and flighted on off, the batsman comes forward and drives it to long on for a single
tossed up and full outside off, this time he doesn't try anything expansive, dabs it towards the off side for a single
full and flat on off stump, Franklin defends it solidly off the front foot
more solid defence from the batsman as he comes forward to push it back to the bowler
length delivery outside off, Baz comes forward and just pushes it towards cover. The ball speeds off his bat and beats the fielder at cover and races to the boundary. A mere push it was
another length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to deep cover.. (The fielder had moved back)
length delivery on off stump, the batsman plays it off the back foot, defends it towards cover
superbly timed! It was a short of length delivery, a bit wide outside off, Franklin just punches it through cover beautifully
length ball outside off, this one is left alone
back of length delivery on off stump, the batsman goes back and defends it solidly to the off side
tossed up delivery on off, Baz defends, awkwardly though
he comes forward and defends the tossed up delivery to the leg side
quicker and flatter this time, Baz goes on the back foot and pushes it to midwicket
flighted and on the leg stump line, the batsman pushes it to the right of midwicket of a single
full and flighted on the pads, Franklin comfortably pushes it to deep midwicket for a single
quicker delivery this time, the batsman shuffles across, then defends it solidly back down the pitch
pushed through outside off, the batsman watches it go through to the keeper
flatter delivery outside off, Franklin comes forward and defends it towards cover
some spin there, but is was slightly short and that allowed the batsman to easily defend it towards point
very very loud appeal for lbw as the batsman misses his sweep shot and gets hit on the pads. They cant' t review it as they have none left, and would have been useless as it hit the gloves

very loud shout again! And this time Rod Tucker waits, waits and then succumbs under pressure. It was  good shout even though the batsman was pressing forward, he was hit marginally on the line of off stump. Good decision and Franklin, who was looking more composed of the two batsmen, has to go
flatter delivery outside off, draws the batsman out, then turns past the outside edge. Lots of noise now around the bat
fuller and quicker, the batsman comes forward in defence, gets an inside edge but he has no idea where it is..
fuller and quick again, the batsman defends it to the off side off the front foot
he stretches right forward and defends it again
goes on the back foot to a tossed up delivery and gets squared up as the ball straightens, gets an outside edge to backward point
full and flighted, the batsman tries to drive it long-on, but hits it off the outside half of the bat to long off
tossed up on middle stump line, Vettori goes down on his knee and paddles it fine on the leg side for a single. He is slow to turn as Baz was looking for a couple
flighted and full on the leg stump, Vettori wanted to drive, but ends up chipping it towards mid-on.. Lucky that he didn't hit it too hard
comes forward and defends it solidly to the off side
on the pads this time, he dabs it towards backward square leg for a quick single
quicker delivery on off stump, the batsman comes right forward and defends it back to the bowler

it is pushed through outside off and Baz goes for a reverse sweep, misses and gets hit on the pads. He prob had his heart in his mouth and there was a loud appeal again, but the impact was outside off
this time, he comes forward and defends to cover
he goes deep into the crease, allows the ball to turn a little, then dabs it towards square leg for a single
Tossed up outside off, the batsman comes forward and plays it down towards that second slip fielder, it drops just short of the fielder. It was played well though
another good shout for lbw! That was outside the line of off though, but no doubt Baz was beaten by the arm-ball again
he thrusts his front foot forward and defends it towards cover
more solid front foot defence from the batsman
tossed up delivery, but this is down the leg side. It flicks the pads and runs down fine
pushed through on off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends it towards point
comes forward again, pushes it to cover
quicker and fuller outside off, the batsman pushes it to cover off the front foot
fuller this time, straying down the leg side, the batsman goes for a sweep, but gets hit on the pads, everyone appeals, but that was going down
full and tossed up on off, the batsman drives it to long off for a single
flatter and quicker outside off, the batsman goes back and punches it to cover
length delivery on off stump, the batsman gets behind it and defends it back to the bowler
here comes the yorker, but well played by Vettori as he opens the face and runs it down to third man
short of length delivery on off stump, the batsman gets up on his toes and dabs it towards cover point, he calls for a quick single and the two make it in time
another yorker, swinging slightly away in the air and it beats the bat
he moves way across outside the off stump and Malinga fires a yorker, but Vettori is lucky that the ball was way down the leg side.. His stumps were totally exposed
and another yorker, this time outside off. Vettori digs it out towards off, but Dilshan at backward point makes a good save to prevent a single

that's game over for Vettori! It's that slower ball and it was a yorker, hits the batsman right in front and that is an easy decision for the umpire. But Vettori was disappointed and rightly so, the ball had hit the inside edge on its way. Unfortunately for him, his friend Kane W had used up the review earlier...
pushed through on off stump, the batsman punches it back to the bowler
shorter and flatter, the batsman shuffles across and whips it to deep square leg for a single

oh another appeal, and he keeps asking the umpire! I think that was very close and McNath is lucky! He was walking across the stumps and missed the delivery as he tried to work it to the leg side, gets hit in front of middle stump.. Hawk eye says it would have spun down the leg side
he waits on the back foot and defends it towards cover
pushed through on off and middle, the batsman works it to deep square leg with the turn
quicker delivery on the pads, the batsman drives it to midwicket
tossed up, but this on the pads, the batsman sweeps it fine leg for an easy single
fuller and quicker on the middle stump, it is driven to the left of the bowler, who does well to stop the ball
this is a slider down the leg side, the batsman fails to get bat on that
oh that stayed low. It was pushed through outside off, the batsman went back and punched it to deep cover
he goes back and across and whips the quicker delivery to midwicket
tossed up full and on the leg stump line, the batsman comes forward and defends it down the pitch
pushed through on off stump, defended off the back foot
fuller deilvery, this one is firmly driven to wide long on and the batsman calls for two immediately, completes it comfortably
goes on the back foot and clips the length delivery on the pads to deep square leg
he bowls it full on off stump, the batsman drives it firmly, but Dilshan dives to his right to cut it off
slower and tossed up outside off, the batsman stretches out and defends it to the off side
full and flat on off stump, the batsman drives it to midwicket
full and flighted on off, the batsman drives it to the left of Herath, but he dives and cuts it off
flighted on the middle stump line, Nathan Mc doesn't hold back, he chips it over wide mid-on and it makes it to the boundary
fuller and on off stump, the batsman drives it easily to long off for a single
he comes forward and defends the flighted delivery to the off side
he thrusts his pad outside the line of off and pads the arm ball away, appeal from behind the stumps, but the bowler doesn't ask the question.. Not coming back enough
he goes forward to defend the tossed up delivery, but gets an inside edge on to his pads. More appealing from behind the stumps, none from the bowler
pushed through from round the wicket, the batsman gets hit on the pads, but that pitched outside leg
quicker delivery on off stump, the batsman goes back and defends it to the leg side
tossed up on the pads, the batsman chips it towards deep midwicket for a single
quicker delivery on off stump, the batsman brings out a sweep shot, manages to get some bat on it to short fine leg, although that is not where he was aiming
fuller delivery on the middle and leg line, driven back to the bowler
now the reverse sweep to one pitched on the middle stump, he gets a top edge on to his helmet grill this time..
he bowls a back of length delivery from wide of the crease, the batsman defends it off the front foot
attempts a yorker wide outside off, but it's a half-volley. It's driven back to the bowler, who partially stops it by sticking his right hand out
back of length delivery on off stump, the batsman defends it from the crease
he bowls it full and wide outside off, the batsman slices it to the off side where Dilshan at point gets a hand to it and slows it down.. Keeps the batsmen to just a single
back of length delivery, the batsman comes forward and defends it to the off side

length delivery on the stumps, Baz drops it towards mid-on and calls for a quick single. Nathan is late to respond to it but the two fielders charging towards the ball confuse each other and the ball goes through.. The batsmen get back for a couple
he bowls it back of length around off stump, some movement back into the batsman, who defends it off the back foot
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman tries to whip it to the leg side, but ends up pushing it in the air towards midwicket.. It just drops a metre short of the fielder
short and wide, he cuts it hard, but straight to Dilshan at gully
length delivery on the off and middle stump line, the batsman defends it off the back foot towards midwicket
short and wide, he cuts it again, this time in the air and it's over the fielder at gully. Eranga at third man has to run around to cut it off
length delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends it solidly to cover
length delivery on off stump, crunched on the up to deep cover for a single, that brings up the team's hundred

loose shot! loud appeal by the keeper! It was a length delivery outside off, the batsman pushed at it away from the body, but he gets beaten and the keeper immediately goes up in an appeal. Sanga was confident, no one else was.. and rightly so
he goes for a yorker, but it ends up being a low full toss that is cracked through extra cover for a welcome boundary
back of length delivery on off stump, the batsman goes back and defends it to the off side
short ball, the batsman plays a pull shot of utmost authority, it is placed in the gap at deep square leg
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to cover point for a single
full delivery on the middle stump, the batsman drives it to wide mid-on comfortably for a single
fuller length delivery just outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends it to point
back of length delivery outside off, he dabs it towards the gap at cover and calls early for a run
fuller length delivery on off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends to off
beautifully driven on the up off a length ball, but straight to the fielder at short cover
length delivery a touch wide outside off, the batsman defends it with an open face, towards backward point
starts off with a yorker that is firmly driven in the air through the left of the bowler.. They take a single, but on another day, that could have been an amazing catch..
bowls a half-volley on the middle stump, the batsman flicks it to deep midwicket for a single
another yorker, this time it's punched back to the bowler
slower yorker outside off, the batsman manages to dig it out towards the bowler, who tries to stop it with his boot, but parries it towards mid-off, the batsmen steal a single
fuller length delivery on the stumps, the batsman drives it to mid-on for a single now

the off stump takes a beating! That's six on the last throw of the dice. Sri Lanka continue to fight. It's that slower yorker again and Baz is completely outfoxed by the lack of pace on that. He tried to whip it to the leg side, but falls over as he plays too early, the ball dips and goes under the bat to hit the off stump..
he bowls it full on off stump, the batsman drives it to wide long off for a single
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and tucks it to square leg for a single
full and flighted on off, Nathan McC drives it firmly, in the air, but just to the right of the man at short cover.. They take a couple to wide long on
another powerful drive, but this time the fielder at short cover makes a half-stop to keep the batsmen to a single
tossed up and slow on off stump, the batsman waits in the crease and defends
that is the slider on off stump, the batsman tries to defend it off the back foot, but he gets an inside edge down to fine leg
another slower yorker on the middle and off stump line, the batsman does well to dig it out back to the bowler

an inswinging yorker does the job, this one was fast, it was mean, it hit the batsman on the back pad.. Infront of the leg stump. Would that have gone on to hit the leg? Possibly. Nathan McCullum's fighting innings has been cut short,  Malinga is doing it for Sri Lanka.. Hawk-eye says that the ball would have just clipped the outside of the leg stump
slower yorker and it's a low full-toss, the batsman is beaten by that, but he gets a toe-end to it towards the non-striker, away from the bowler
now a fast and inswinging yorker on the leg stump, the batsman tucks it away to deep backward square leg for a single
he bowls a fuller and slower delivery wider outside off, the batsman pokes at it, gets an outside edge, but that drops just short of Sangakkara
another slower yorker! The batsman somehow manages to get bat on it and takes a single as it goes towards backward point
he bowls it flat and quick around off stump, the batsman tucks it towards midwicket for an easy single
tossed up delivery wide outside off, it was the carrom ball, the batsman defends it to cover off the front foot
flighted and full on off, the batsman pushes it in the gap at cover and calls for a quick single
quicker and slightly shorter on off, the batsman easily rocks back and punches it to deep midwicket
pushed through on off stump, the batsman defends off the front foot
slower and tossed up on off, the batsman comes forward and defends it to midwicket
loud loud appeal! It was inswinging fuller length delivery, it pitches around middle stump and hits the pads, heading down the leg side

now a pacy yorker and another loud appeal for lbw, but the ball heads to the third-man boundary.. Was it bat, was it the boot first? It was the boot, and it would have been out.. Lucky escape for New Zealand

this time it's a low full toss on the leg stump, this time Southee is lucky that he gets an inside edge on to his pads.. The sound was loud and clear and it shut all the fielders up.. But how good is this over!
goes for a yorker, but this is outside off and it's driven past the non-striker, the mid-on fielder dives and stops it, and pushes it towards the mid-off fielder.. Easy single though
another low full toss, it was heading for the base of the middle stump, the batsman gets his bat down in time and hits it straight to midwicket
full and a touch wide outside off, the batsman digs it out to the man at short cover
fuller delivery on off stump, the batsman digs it out to deep cover for a single
length delivery angling in from wide of the crease, the batsman comes forward and defends it solidly to the off side

high full toss on off stump, the batsman guides it straight to point and sets off for a single.. Dilshan fires it at the non-striker's end, but the batsman would have been safe even if he had hit. Close though
full and on off stump, the batsman drives it straight to short cover

another yorker! the batsman digs it out towards mid-on and sets off for a single, the fielder at mid-on - Thisara - aims at the non-striker's end, but misses. However, his throw goes on to hit the stumps at striker's end and guess what, Mills is short!
he bowls it fast and on a length, the batsman defends it like an opener.. very solid
a yorker aimed at leg stump? not quite, this goes down the leg side and NZ have a run
a super yorker just outside off stump, the batsman digs it out, gets an inside edge to his pads
fuller delivery on off stump, swinging in, the batsman punches it back to the bowler via the inside edge and his front pad
goes for a length delivery outside off, the batsman tries to push it to off, gets another inside edge on to his pads
killer yorker! aimed at the middle stump, swinging towards leg.. the batsman somehow digs it out, gets his toe out of the way right at the last moment
length delivery outside off, the batsman pushes it to cover point
it's a faster yorker outside off, the batsman blocks it out towards cover.
tossed up delivery wide outside off, the batsman lets it go
pushed through on the leg stump line, the batsman dabs it to square leg for a single
pushed through on the middle and leg line, the batsman dabs it to backward square leg with the turn for a single

tossed up on leg stump, but this is down the leg side, and Sanga misses it.. They run back for the second, because there was a belated call for a wide.. it's over.. New Zealand have made it through...
